name: Business policies and procedures are inefficient
description: Rationale and/or practical approach adopted for business fail to demonstrate optimal efficiency.
notes:
- Do measurable aspects of performance compare favourably with those of similar organisations?
- How does the repository's current operational efficiency compare with its peak level? 

The full description of this risk has been obtained from examples provided in DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment, March 2007, Digital Curation Centre (DCC) and Digital Preservation Europe (DPE), http://www.repositoryaudit.eu/
preMitigationNotes:
- Repository makes objects available one hour after a dissemination request, but comparable organisations providing similar content are capable of doing so in just 30 minutes
- Revised policies are demonstrably less efficient than those that preceded
mitigationStrategy:
Avoidance strategies:
- Expose policies and procedures to regular review to determine their efficiency and appropriateness with respect to organisational goals
- Seek external validation of policies and procedures (e.g. accredited auditors or user communities) In the event of riskâ€™s execution:
- Identify those policies that are inefficient and revise them accordingly
identifiedBy: DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment
